conclusion: To determine which container (D, E, or F) each colored liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to follow the flow of each liquid individually and see where they end up.
A (pink) flows downward initially but is intercepted by the yellow baffle.
B (green) flows horizontally but is intercepted by the blue baffle.
After hitting the yellow baffle, the pink liquid will flow to the right and reach container D.
After hitting the blue baffle, the green liquid will flow downward and reach container F.
The blue liquid continues straight down and reaches container E.
Container D (cyan) is positioned to receive pink liquid.
Container E (dark green) is positioned to receive blue liquid.
Container F (light green) is positioned to receive green liquid.
